com.diffplug.gradle.spotless

Interface FormatterStep

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FormatterStep.Strict

    public interface FormatterStep
extends Serializable
    An implementation of this class specifies a single step in a formatting process. The input is guaranteed to have unix-style newlines, and the output is required to not introduce any windows-style newlines as well.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FormatterStep.Strict<Key extends Serializable>
      Implements a FormatterStep in a strict way which guarantees correct and lazy implementation of up-to-date checks.

      default FormatterStep filterByFile(SerializableFileFilter filter)
      Returns a new FormatterStep which will only apply its changes to files which pass the given filter.
      default void finish()
      Hint to the FormatterStep that format(String, File) will not be called anytime soon, so clean up any resources that are being used.
      String format(String rawUnix, File file)
      Returns a formatted version of the given content.
      String getName()
      The name of the step, for debugging purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the step, for debugging purposes.

      • format

        String format(String rawUnix,
              File file)
       throws Throwable
        Returns a formatted version of the given content.
        Parameters:
        rawUnix - File's content, guaranteed to have unix-style newlines ('\n')
        file - the File which is being formatted
        Returns:
        The formatted content, guaranteed to only have unix-style newlines
        Throws:
        Throwable - when the formatter steps experiences a problem

      • finish

        default void finish()
        Hint to the FormatterStep that format(String, File) will not be called anytime soon, so clean up any resources that are being used. Does NOT guarantee that format() won't be called ever again, but does guarantee to be the best possible time to clean that you're going to get.

      • filterByFile

        default FormatterStep filterByFile(SerializableFileFilter filter)
        Returns a new FormatterStep which will only apply its changes to files which pass the given filter. The provided filter must be serializable.

      • createLazy

        static <Key extends Serializable> FormatterStep createLazy(String name,
                                                           Throwing.Supplier<Key> keySupplier,
                                                           Throwing.Function<Key,Throwing.Function<String,String>> keyToFormatter)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the formatter step
        keySupplier - If the rule has any state, this supplier will calculate it lazily, and the result will be passed to keyToFormatter
        keyToFormatter - A pure function which generates a formatting function using only the state supplied by key and nowhere else.
        Returns:
        A FormatterStep

      • create

        static <Key extends Serializable> FormatterStep create(String name,
                                                       Key key,
                                                       Throwing.Function<Key,Throwing.Function<String,String>> keyToFormatter)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the formatter step
        key - If the rule has any state, this key must contain all of it
        keyToFormatter - A pure function which generates a formatting function using only the state supplied by key and nowhere else.
        Returns:
        A FormatterStep

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the formatter step

        keyToFormatter - A pure function which generates a closeable formatting function using only the state supplied by key and nowhere else.

        A FormatterStep
